comment.author: 38123137@N00
comment._content: Great momento! -- Nice revisiting of Hyde Park, in Sydney ... but when? ~ 1890s? Later? -- "DREAM A GREEN-SCENE FOR EACH WASTE SPACE!" Imagine fully re-green cities!!! Tree avenues, big potted plants, floral median-strips, street-lamps with hanging flower baskets!! Join the celebrations ~ Our Green preparations. Add me as friend! Invite civic bodies, park venues, etc. if you wish. WILLIAM PHILLIPS [1825-1911] ECO-CENTENARY 2011 ~ UK-IRELAND-ITALY, &C -- AWARD Help Celebrate his 2011 ECO-CENTENARY FESTIVAL at CULTURAL HALLS, **PARK GAZEBOS, or CONCERT BANDSTANDS** >

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Australian Museum at left, chimneys of Sydney Grammar School left or band stand, and statue of Captain Cook right of band stand. This band stand must have been on the north west corner of William and College Streets, photo looking south.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's a few sketches of Hyde Park which appeared in the Australian Town & Country Journal in July 1895 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5242982

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=qFZVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=npUDA... - This 1898 Sydney Mail pic is from a similar angle...the SM pic doesn't show telegraph poles (though it's possible they were blanked out for aesthetic reasons...I've discovered that the newspapers sometimes altered their photos)...and it shows what appears to be a gas lamp. Going on the SM pic I'd say this PHM pic (above) was taken at a later date.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: These 2 SLNSW pics are worth knowing about - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413407 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413408 ...and don't forget the companion pic - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2758595439/ ...and here's a bit of a reality check in case you're too spellbound by these idyllic images of Hyde Park - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14642718

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: There's a similar view in this 1901 Sydney Mail article - news.google.com/newspapers?id=ugFQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=-5QDA...
